snippet: Jimmy Greene, a jazz saxophone player, put down his horn after his daughter died in the Newtown school massacre. But since then, he has found musical inspiration in his loss.
abstract: Top-tier jazz saxophone player Jimmy Greene found musical inspiration in his grief following death of daughter Ana Marquez-Greene in Newtown, Conn, school massacre; Green is performing at Smoke in Manhattan, playing cuts from new album Beautiful Life, work inspired by and dedicated to his daughter's life.
lead_paragraph: Jimmy Greene, a jazz saxophone player, put down his horn after his daughter died in the Newtown school massacre. But since then, he has found musical inspiration in his loss.

headline.main: Grieving Father Finds an Outlet in His Music
headline.print_headline: Grieving Father Finds An Outlet in His Music
